posts._title: Naomi Kawase – Ni tsutsumarete AKA Embracing (1992)
posts.title: Ni tsutsumarete
posts.excerpt: In this autobiographical documentary, filmmaker Naomi Kawase seeks to reach her mother and father who abandoned her at birth.

posts.title: The Florist
posts.excerpt: A man who has devoted his life to tending roses finally confronts his love objects, castigating them for their preening self-regard and disregard of his own feelings, resulting in a violent catharsis.

posts.title: Frontier Blues
posts.excerpt: This is the debut feature film written and directed by the Iranian born Babak Jalali, presented as a world première in August 2009 at the 62nd Locarno International Film Festival. FRONTIER BLUES features 4 intertwined stories all set in Iran’s northern frontier with Turkmenistan, a region that has long been neglected in Iranian cinema, interesting …

posts._title: Joe Gibbons – Living in the World (1985)
posts.title: Living in the World
posts.excerpt: An auto-documentary about a disenfranchised Everyman and his struggle to re-integrate himself into society. He fails and turns to crime.

posts._title: Warrington Hudlin – Black at Yale: A Film Diary (1974)
posts.title: Black at Yale: A Film Diary
posts.excerpt: The film was directed by Hudlin while he was a Yale College senior, and focuses on the experiences of African-American students at Yale in the early 1970s. The influential documentary short follows students Erroll McDonald and Eugene Rivers, and features a conversation with civil rights activist Stokely Carmichael.

posts._title: Pierre Granier-Deferre – L’ami de Vincent AKA A Friend of Vincent (1983)
posts.title: L’ami de Vincent
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:The Bear and the Fox, or What Friends Are for: ‘The bear, played by Philippe Noiret, is the conductor of a music hall orchestra, a kind hearted soul, always ready to help the next person if need arises. The fox, played by Jean Rochefort, is a trumpeter in the bear’s orchestra and his friend since …

posts._title: Liwen Ma – Wo men lia AKA You And Me (2005)
posts.title: Wo men lia
posts.excerpt: One snowy day, a girl looking for a place to stay jumps into the private residence of an old woman. First they both dislike one another, though as they spend more time together their friendship grow. However, one day the girl must leave the house of the old woman.

posts._title: Philippe Garrel – La cicatrice intérieure AKA The Inner Scar (1972)
posts.title: La cicatrice intérieure
posts.excerpt: This is a highly experimental French film consisting of no more than 23 camera shots, total. It resembles nothing so much as one of Warhol’s earlier films, except that it is more episodic. Nico of the Velvet Underground portrays a different woman in each of the episodes. The first three concern her “rescues” from Death …

posts.title: Shi
posts.excerpt: Mija lives with her middle-schooler grandson in a small suburban city located along the Han River. She is a dandy old lady who likes to dress up in flower-decorated hats and fashionable outfits, but she is also an unpredictable character with an inquisitive mind. By chance she takes a poetry class at a neighborhood cultural …

posts._title: Ming Zhang – Wu shan yun yu AKA Rainclouds over Wushan (1996)
posts.title: Wu shan yun yu
posts.excerpt: Mai Qiang is a 30-year old bachelor, withdrawn, with little in his life besides his job at an isolated signal station along the Yangtze River and his ink drawings he uses as toilet paper. Chen Qing is a hotel clerk, a widow with a young child and an undemanding relationship with her boss Lao Mo. …
